title: How can Filipina girls audition in SM, YG, or JYP if they can't speak Korean? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can join the online audition for YG and JYP. Or maybe Global audition like SM did last year (2018) if theres any this year. It doesnt mather that you cant speak korean. If you really pass the online audition or audition i think they will call you face to face, there should be a translator so you can communicate without using korean language. Well i never pass the online audition but i ever got casted by SM and im Indonesian btw. They will not ask you to speak korean, they just ask what language you master and stuff. Plus.. if you really pass and become a trainnee, they will teach you how to speak korean. If you really want to audition, just focus on yout talent. Hope this help

Anyone can audition for the Big3 regardless of age/gender/nationality. If you are accepted as a trainee in the company, most likely you will be in an international school to learn Korean or the company will have people to teach you. It doesn’t hurt to learn Korean before auditioning though!

You can learn Korean. Some companies allow trainees to learn Korean from teachers. Big companies have people who speak English. When you audition, they just care about your talent. The language is a whole new thing.

All of the big agencies have a few staff members who can speak English these days, and anyway they are primarily evaluating your talent and star quality during your auditions. However, I strongly suggest learning at least a few weeks of Korean before auditioning if you want to show you’re serious.
As a south Korean, Korea like foreigners who can speak Korean.  In Korea TV show ‘비정상회담’, foreigners who appear to the show are able to speak Korean so they are popular in Korea.
